audiovisuals.description: Audiovisual works spanning film, photography, and digital media. These projects explore heritage, culture, architecture, and identity through moving image and sound.

items.title: Stained Glass Restoration
items.description: The great east window at St Anne’s depicts the Crucifixion in a huge size. It is over 150 years old and badly in need of repair. Our sponsor a pane appeal is making great progress, and you can still contribute to the conservation of the window by sponsoring an area of the picture.

items.title: Aberfeldy Estate
items.description: An exploration of regeneration through point clouds scattering.

items.title: Passing the Flame
items.description: A series of images to document the first black woman to represent Britain in the Olympics. These photos facilitated the digitisation of her memorabillia.

items.title: Archives Also Die
items.description: Caught in a maze of bureaucratic absurdity and colonial remnants, a British-Nigerian filmmaker reassembles their fractured identity through archival images, brutalist architecture, and experimental cinema—interrogating the power and politics of memory.

metadata.director_statement: Growing up as “Peter” in the UK, I came of age at the intersection of administrative fiction and diasporic truth...

items.title: Natural Architecture
items.description: Set within the storied landscape of Spain, this cinematic journey follows a community of apprentices, architects, and master engineers as they gather to reimagine architecture through stone...

sculptures.description: Sculptural and public art projects documented through film and photography. These works examine material, architecture, and cultural memory in physical space.

items.title: The Hop
items.description: The Hop is a large interactive sculpture by artist Jyll Bradley...

items.title: the stone they lay
items.description: Hidden in plain sight, a set of stone benches in London becomes the vessel for a poetic excavation...

items.title: Jewellery Design
items.description: Vannetta Seecharran School of Jewellery '23 | New Designers Business Design Centre

people.description: Portraits, workshops, and films centred on individuals, communities, and cultural practitioners. These stories highlight lived experience, creativity, and collective struggles.

items.title: Echoes of the Empire
items.description: In our latest event, we screened The Strangers Home, 2024 by James King, a film commissioned by Thames Festival Trust. It deserves the big screen and surround sound—an eerie mood swept viewers into a world shaped by identity, censorship, and fake news.

items.title: The Lighting Designer
items.client: Contemporary Art Society & The Box, Plymouth
items.description: Learn about the Lighting technicians role as we explore an exhibition at the Box in Plymouth.

items.title: Hostile Housing
items.description: Rents are spiralling, housing conditions are worsening and property speculation is rampant...

items.title: Eco Soy Wax Candles
items.description: Brand Strategy and Content Creation for an eco-friendly candle-making business.

items.title: Stacy Lynn Waddell Epitaph
items.description: Presented at the Visual Arts Center of Richmond from November 13, 2015 to January 8, 2016...

items.title: The Conservator
items.client: Contemporary Art Society & Norwich Castle Museum
items.description: Learn about the Conservator role as we explore an exhibition at the Norwich Castle Museum and Art Gallery.

items.title: Frieze Masters
items.description: Frieze Masters offers a unique contemporary perspective on thousands of years of art history, from collectible objects to significant masterpieces from the ancient era and Old Masters to the late 20th century. The 2025 edition of the fair will showcase over 130 of the most significant galleries from around the world.

items.description: An experimental film exploring identity and motion...
items.story: The genesis of this film lies in a serendipitous meeting...
